channel.title: Games That Are Truly Well Done
channel.description:
Lack of better Title.
HL1 I would find myself trying to peer/peek over a ramp or wall with railing to see if there were any enemies or to see them after hearing them but instead I would find myself peering over the top of my monitor.
Anybody else have such moments in games that were so well made that you would actually do something akin to that.

item.title: Games That Are Truly Well Done
item.dc:creator: SkyBlue
item.description:
Indiana Jones and the Emperor’s Tomb. The animations are so well done, you can almost feel every punch and whip swing, especially where you jump then use your whip.

Read full topic

item.title: Games That Are Truly Well Done
item.dc:creator: Pheonix_Wright
item.description:
Someonerandm:

I’ve had worse, specifically loosing about five hours of Morrowind gameplay. But yeah, I wish STALKER had better autosave, because as is you either get unimmersed by hammering F6 or loose half your game.

you know whats even more immersion breaking? dying…your not supposed to die in stalker…who needs quicksave? :retard:

Read full topic
item.source: Games That Are Truly Well Done

item.title: Games That Are Truly Well Done
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Floyd:

Red Forest is awesome. Went in at dusk and spent the whole night trying to find my way out. Thought I went in there well prepared, finally got out with virtually just pistol ammo left. Probably the most lengthy white-knuckled gaming experiences I’ve had.

I skimmed past very quickly. The only nuisance was that fucking psy-dog.
Wasted a quarter of my VSS ammo trying to hit it from 100 meters.

I hate engaging them and then losing track of the real ones in the ocean of replicas.

Read full topic
item.source: Games That Are Truly Well Done

item.title: Games That Are Truly Well Done
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
I was going artifact hunting in Jupiter in CoP, died in an anomaly, and quickloaded to find that I had last saved over an hour ago.

Fuck my life. I’d just gotten one of the best artifact scanners, a new helmet, finished like 3 quests, and now I get to do it all over.

Read full topic
item.source: Games That Are Truly Well Done

item.title: Games That Are Truly Well Done
item.dc:creator: Floyd
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

What makes it shine is that you can get some traces of Ukrainian here and there. Yeah, they speak Russian, but there is an occasional word of Ukrainian origin slipping through from time to time. Especially with bandits (bandits use a lot characteristic thieves’ jargon in their speech, btw). And the accent is generally quite ukranian (except from high ranked NPCs), too.Very authentic, considering…

OldDirtyBastard:

Majority of Ukrainian population speaks or at least knows Russian. The languages are nearly identical, though Ukrainian is funny as hell to anyone who speaks Russian.

Didn’t know any of this. Useful to know.

OldDirtyBastard:

Me. I’m about to enter red forest.
It also strikes me how much more ruble I spend in CS compared to SHoC.
I used to accumulate more than 400k in SHoC. In CS, I spend tonnes on upgrades and ammo.

Red Forest is awesome. Went in at dusk and spent the whole night trying to find my way out. Thought I went in there well prepared, finally got out with virtually just pistol ammo left. Probably the most lengthy white-knuckled gaming experiences I’ve had.

Read full topic
item.source: Games That Are Truly Well Done

item.title: Games That Are Truly Well Done
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Kairouseki:

I like the odd Russian phrases in the Stalker games that have no translations. I was kind of sad that there wasn’t as much Russian thrown in in CoP as compared to SoC.

I find the russian accents hilarious so its a worthwhile compromise. Also it annoys me in SoC when they try to give game relevant information in Russian, and I end up having no idea whats going on. It certainly is a flawed masterpiece.

Read full topic

item.title: Games That Are Truly Well Done
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Like we have no idea what all the NPCs say to eachother round campfires etc.

I do. It’s usually anecdotes and general reflections/bitching about life in the zone. What makes it even more brilliant is that the anecdotes can be both funny and not funny.

Siggs:

Anyone here play stalker without the Complete mods? I got CoP a while back, but only just started to play it because the complete mod was released. They’re essential imho

You can live without them, but you’re better off with them. I’ve finished my first SHOC playthrough without it.
I had my own quirks with the mod itself, like disabling head-bobbing and no npc weapon tossing upon death.
Had to manually enable them back. Other than that and the fact that my lappy likes to slowdown at times (on max settings sans MSAA) in CS, the mod is damn good.

Pssh who wants to play Clear Sky.

Me. I’m about to enter red forest.
It also strikes me how much more ruble I spend in CS compared to SHoC.
I used to accumulate more than 400k in SHoC. In CS, I spend tonnes on upgrades and ammo.

Read full topic
item.source: Games That Are Truly Well Done

item.title: Games That Are Truly Well Done
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
I wouldn’t say they’re essential, really. I have a lot of fun without them, but they definitely improve the experience for me.

Read full topic
